channel.title: Compiler Help rep++

item.title: Compiler Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

His error isn’t indicating that it cannot find the path to Java, its indicating that it cannot find either the output or input folder.
Where is your compiler in relation to your Java files?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @peepzi peepzi
item.description:
@peepzi wrote:

:: ::
:: This Compiler is under no licenses and may ::
:: be distributed freely. ::
:: ::
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

Yes, everything is right where it should be.

If I put this in;

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

It works but my Compiler gives me 100 errors (useing DSPK).

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Help rep++
item.dc:creator: @Pblord7 Pblord7
item.description:
@Pblord7 wrote:

[quote=“James-RevolutionX, post:1, topic:377129”]Everytime I click build, I get “The System cannot find the Path specified.”

My directory is;

@echo off
title Building Files
“C:\Program Files (x86)\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe” -d ./Class/ Java/.java Java/sign/.java
pause

And i’ve set my Enviromental Varibles.[/quote]
Do you have JDK 22 >.>

Read full topic
